sentence.text: He put a nacho chip in his mouth and soaked it with beer .
Blood from his torn ear was soaking his left epaulette with its tarnished chains and gilded eagle .
The curtain of rain caught them up and in a moment soaked them to the skin .
While they were in the pub , in a corner far from a window , the rain had come on heavily , the kind of rain that will soak you to the skin in two minutes .
In a wide bowl there was the night glimmer of a stream which was churned to flashing silver as they thrashed through it , the spray soaking them to their thighs .
There 's a red trickle , running down the wall , seeping through the gaps in the floorboards and soaking the sand beneath .
He felt the rain soak his clothes , slash his cheeks , trickle inside his collar .
Her hands sweated and soaked the steering-wheel .
Firemen were soaking everything to finally extinguish the blaze .
The drizzle was already soaking it darker .
" I soaked a piece of cotton wool in ether and chucked that in . "
He turned on the taps and thrust my face and head into the water and completely soaked my shirt and jacket .
We shall soak the walls of the two trenches with this stuff , also soak the camouflage squares before wrapping them round our heads , then we can settle down tonight free of mosquitoes . "
Sometimes he even managed to keep for himself the little piece of cotton-wool that she soaked in perfume so that he could rub the henna stains from her skin .
